reviews.text: We went out for my nieces 39th birthday at The Lobster House on City Island in the Bronx. I have been going to this restaurant for years and have enjoyed my experiences. The past few visits have been disappointing. The food looks and tastes good. However, 6/8 of us were ill within stomach aches within an hour of leaving the restaurant.  We will not be returning after many years of loving The Lobster House in City Island.

First time visiting and it did not disappoint! The food is excellent and the portions are huge! You will leave stuffed! The garlic bread is awesome! I had the jumbo shrimp Parmesan and it was delicious! When they say jumbo, they mean gigantic! My friend had the special with the lobster tail and it was also delicious! And to top it off, the service was great! Our sever was Oscar and he took care of us! This is definitely a place to try!

Lobster house is always great. Service is excellent. Very attentive, friendly and quick. Food is excellent especially the crab legs oreganata style and the shrimp parmigiana. The complimentary garlic bread and salad are also great.
I had an amazing experience at Lobster House. Oscar, our server, was very attentive and friendly. I canâ€™t wait to visit again! 10/10

Impeccable service ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ğŸ¤ŒğŸ» my Daughter took   her Husband and myself for our birthday we had a goid time the everything was so nice the service was the best I ever had food was amazing the drinks 10 ğŸŒŸ ğŸ¤© price sid not matter the food the service wad worth every penny plus a generous tip worth it there Pina Colada drink whew so  good I had shrimp house salad baked potato the garlic bread and salad they bring before your meal the house dressing ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹I do not eat olives  but I ate them at Lobster House thats how good there food try it im ready to go back

We recently visited City Island Lobster House to celebrate a friendâ€™s birthday and had a truly wonderful experience. From the moment we arrived, the staff were exceptionally welcoming, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

The food was outstanding â€” flavorful, well-prepared, and served in shareable portions that made dining together even more enjoyable. Our server, Anthony, was incredibly attentive and knowledgeable. He ensured our table was well taken care of throughout the evening, and our drinks were consistently perfect.

Jojo, the owner, was friendly and approachable, which added a personal touch to our visit. Overall, the atmosphere was vibrant and comfortable, making us feel genuinely appreciated as guests.

Iâ€™m already looking forward to my next visit to City Island Lobster House.
The food is A plus the best. If you bring a appetite... You will be satisfied.

Tried it for the first time today Oscar was our server a very professional server very nice man, The food was great , The portions are nice sized and the flavors are excellent, definitely worth going back over and over
Un lugar donde hay muy buena atenciÃ³n, la comida espectacular. Muy recomendable

The food was good
The service was great. As you can see, I had the whole Red Snapper. It was fried just right. Please go and experience it for yourself.
Delicious food and drink. Friendly service.
One of the gems in city island ! I love their menu and service .

LOBSTER HOUSE â€“ CITY ISLAND, NY
I brought my daughter to LOBSTER HOUSE in CITY ISLAND, NY to celebrate her birthday, which was on Sunday. I decided to come today instead so it would be less crowded. I have two favorite restaurants on City Island, but my daughter really wanted to try Lobster House â€” and I wish we hadnâ€™t.
We arrived around 12 PM, and the place wasnâ€™t packed at all. I wanted to sit outside, but right away I noticed a black rug on the floor that looked like it hadnâ€™t been swept in days. Then I noticed that the silverware didnâ€™t look clean, which made me uncomfortable before I even got my food.
Our waiter was awesome, the only positive part of our visit, but unfortunately, everything else went downhill from there. I ordered the steak and lobster tail, and when the food came out, the onion rings on top of my steak were cold, and so was the lobster tail. The only thing warm on the plate was the baked potato, which ended up being the only thing I ate. I packed up the rest to go, completely disappointed.
To make it worse, one of the Spanish employees was talking about customers in Spanish, not realizing I speak Spanish too. That was unprofessional and disrespectful.
My bill came to almost $150, and I have never paid that much for cold steak and lobster in my life. My virgin piÃ±a colada was watered down, like it came from an old, overused machine.
This was honestly the worst dining experience Iâ€™ve ever had. I was ready to throw my food to the seagulls outside. The ONLY good Experience was my Waiter. I will NEVER come back to LOBSTER HOUSE in CITY ISLAND, NY.

I went on October 5th.  The food as always was delicious. The service was good. The atmosphere, not  good, because there was a loud party completely inconsiderate of others with non stop  loud talking and cackling laughter. (Not the restaurants fault). When we left, the valet brought my car, a  2023 Genesis. I immediately noticed that a plastic piece was hanging from the bumper cover. I then saw that the bumper drape on the passenger front was indented, there was a cut in the bumper and the bottom passenger side headlight lens was cracked. The valet attendant denied responsibility, and didn't make eye contact.
I spoke to the owner. He immediately defended his valet parking attendants like an overprotective  parent would defend his child. This was without even asking the attendants or viewing the damage. He was very defensive telling me the damage was preexisting. It almost seemed like he already was aware this happened. He made several stupid comments including claiming that it couldn't have happened in his lot because the valets back the cars in. Moronic. I said another car could have easily clipped my bumper while the attendant was backing in. He did not want to hear it, claimed his valets are perfect and that they would have immediately informed him had if they were responsible.(maybe they did). He denied  having cameras and walked away.
I took the car to a collision place. The estimate is between $5000-$6000. I would never go back. The owner is rude, takes no responsibility, and who knows what else he'll say couldn't  happen in his restaurant as evidenced by other 0ne star reviews.
Best on City Island!!!! BIG portions, great service!
Food is always delicious here and the staff attentive. Expect to spend a little extra but the portions are very generous. Can be a little loud in the weekend.
Staff is very friendly and welcoming.

Had a fantastic birthday meal here this evening.
Food and staff were outstanding.
absolutely the best seafood I ever had hands down
Billy  is the best waiter.
Great service and food!

You come here to be able to sit outside by the water. Otherwise not a great deal. Food is good but should be better considering the prices. I had the Shrimp Scampi (over rice).  It was plentiful but I like mine a little more wet - gimme that Scampi sauce!!  My companion had the lobster roll and she enjoyed it. Bonus is the garlic bread they provide free of charge.  Best to go on a beautiful evening to enjoy the outdoor seating
Great food and service is always great!
This is a classy excellent seafood restaurant where you can relax with family and enjoy excellent food
The food was delicious as usual.  Our server was great and she checked on us frequently
Food was delicious and very fresh. Service ? Depends on who you get as a server. Would recommend quality food.
Food was great and so was the service

Always a good experience.
Service and food are excellent.
Great seafood ğŸ˜‹
Sat outside! the views were breathtaking.

Exceeded my expectations due to the late time of my order. About an hour before closing. Food was soooo delicious and flavorful! Very fresh and tasty. I got mussels in red sauce which was so delicious, the sauce had lots of fresh garlic and onion it definitely tasted homemade. Also I got oysters rockefeller which I loved because it wasnâ€™t salty, had the perfect amount of FRESH spinach and the cheese was phenomenalâ€”10/10. Will dine here again.
BuenÃ­simo ğŸ‘
I didn't like the food and the staff was very inattentive.

Broil seafood combination it was delicious.  The only thing  the waitress foul up the bill. I gave her cash for tip and my company added her tip. To her bill my receipt for the tip had zero tattoo in 2 days later I was being charged again for the tip how to make phone calls get the other person on the phone and we had to do a three-way which I don't understand because my receipt said 0 for my credit card and my company had cash on her receipt It the receipt unbelievable
Good food nothing to go crazy for
Great location. Food taste and service were avg.
The place wasnâ€™t outstanding, but it wasnâ€™t disappointing. But the food was A1.
Fun! Fun! Fun!
Excelent service
Prime rib was not good

First, I want to thank our waiter, Steve; he was terrific! From the moment we arrived, Steve was attentive and professional, explaining the dinner plates on the menu. My wife and I tried the steak, lobster course, and lobster clam bake special! It's a great recommendation. It's a great place with a wonderful view. My wife and I really enjoyed the food and the service!

2nd time eating here. Overall a good and fun experience. Persons in the group enjoyed the atmosphere (sat outside with view of the Marina). All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. Love the antipasto, salad and garlic bread service that comes with the meal. We all pretty much ordered lobster and some also had shrimp. Had the calamari as appetizer. Food portions were good. Everyone had leftovers to take home. Would go back
Love it here!
Service was fantastic but the food could do with more seasoning.
Always a pleasure
Delicious seafood!
Joe and staff are the best!!!  Docked and dined. Everything was fantastic.
Me encanto este restaurante!! ComÃ­ un chicken Alfredo el mÃ¡s delicioso que he comido todo sÃºper rico y el personal super amable especialmente Israel y los muchachos de la barra
Absolutely incredible experience, sitting outside, great views, awesome server, and immaculate views.
First time there on a date with the wife; staff, food, service, price for the quality of everything, all beautiful. Very good experience.

Was visitng in the area and stopped by to eat. The last few times we visited City Island, the experience wasn't so great. The good restaurants are long gone and the ones left are commercialized.  We decided to stop and grab a bite. It has been a super long time I've dined here. The food was great! Fresh and good portions! Service was great! Danielle was our waitress. She was super friendly and attentive! The white sangria was delicious!  It is great to know that there is still a family owned establishment that values great service and even greater food. On our way out we stopped to chat quickly with Joe the owner! Kudos to you and your team! I highly recommend this restaurant! When back in the area, we'll definitely visit again!!

Our waiterwas Moises, he was very good and attentive. The food was fresh and fulfilling. I ordered the margarita and it was the best I ever had. I donâ€™t know what they doing back there but the whole team here was definitely on point. This will definitely be my primary choice. Next time I come to city Island.

I visited City Island Lobster House after hearing amazing things about it, and I was really looking forward to it. My date had been there before and enjoyed it, so my expectations were pretty high.

The food was tasty and the service was okay, but honestly, I left feeling a bit disappointed. I wanted to sit by the edge to enjoy the ocean view, but we were told those tables were only for large groups, so my partner and I (just the two of us) werenâ€™t allowed to sit there.

What really confused me was that a group of three came in shortly after. They could have easily sat at one of the smaller tables, but the staff brought out a table and let them sit right by the edge â€” exactly where we had asked to sit.

So while the food was good, the experience didnâ€™t meet my expectations, especially after all the great things I had heard. I just expected a little more.

Outstanding experience! Victor is the man. Try to get a table outside or in the back if possible for more atmosphere. Great value in the enormous entrees - shared 2 entrees between 3 people and it was more than enough food. Everything was delicious. Canâ€™t wait to return.

This place is awesome. We sat on the porch overlooking the water. That garlic bread is everything people claim. Just amazing. I knocked off one star because the lobster was overcooked. But I'll still be back. Beware, this place is not cheap. Steve was just phenomenal! ğŸ’¸ğŸ’¸

We have been coming here for at least 25 years to get a 3 pound lobster and steamers.  The outdoors restaurant is facing the bay and itâ€™s always so beautiful to sit enjoy the view and eat the most spectacular seafood ever. Today, a Tuesday in May at noon time , all was quiet , the outdoor space closed but we were welcomed by Billy. Our server for the day who he made our lunch outing a PHENOMENAL EXPERIENCE. He told us the $50 special was a great price and everything was fresh. Clams, mussels a 1 1/25 pound lobster. Soup. Bread and salad and dessert. We said letâ€™s do it. Will come back for the 3 pounder another time . Well. Phenomenal.  Out of this world. Everything was so FRESH AND DELICIOUS. Billy was right!!  Will never go back to anything else other than this special. French fries were great too. Billy even gave us an amaretto shot at the end.  Best waiter ever. Thank you Billy.  See you soon.

The service and waiters were all amazing, they definitely made our early Motherâ€™s Day lunch an amazing time. My issue was with the food. Everything from the fries to the seafood was cold. Maybe it was a lunch time fluke. But the waiters were amazing.

We were seated outdoors, with a beautiful view of City Islands coast. The portions here are for those who really bring their appetite.  The calamari was delicious, as was the shrimp scampi. I ordered the lobster roll to give it a try, it was good, but it needed something to make it delicious.

I come here at least five times a year for the last eight years and it has never disappointed me. Food is great, if it was closer to me, I would be there every weekend, but itâ€™s an hour and 40 minutes away from me.

So Iâ€™ve been coming here several years. There service is good and food is pretty good as well. They always start you off with a salad, garlic bread (delicious BTW), corn bread and a small cheese and olive platter. One of my favorite dish to order there there is the grilled seafood platter. Itâ€™s a little of everything (shrimp, fish, clam, mussels, scallops and lobster tail) and I always have enough to bring home for lunch the following day. But I came here yesterday for my bday and the lobster tail I got was sad looking. It was the size of my lip balm. ğŸ¤£ I guess shrinkflation had hit.
Six satisfied women celebrating ğŸ¾ Birthdays. Our waitress, awesome! Food, above and beyond, damn delicious especially the platter. ğŸ‘Œ
We ate at lobster house restsurant food is great. Valet parking. We will be back.

I have been to City Island all my life, and I have never been at this location. Once you cross the bridge, you make a left. They were we welcoming and have valet parking. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic. Their menu have a wide selection of things to choose from. Not crowded at all, and you can select to eat indoors or outdoors. We will definitely return.

First guest of the day and my waitress Arlette was great. She recommended the margarita on the rocks. That drink was strong (I loved it) yet smooth. She was also very sweet and attentive, despite having other customers. Make sure you tip her well! The food was really good. Iâ€™m going back.

I wanted to love this place. Came here for Easter dinner very excited to try! My wifeâ€™s brother (whose taste in restaurants is good) has been talking this place up to me for years so expectations were highâ€¦.

And not met! It was super crowded and the restaurant seemed to clearly be unable to handle the volume of Easter service. I say this for a few reasons. 1. The menu was drastically reduced, basically pushing you to get lobster tails or crab. 2. The wait staff were clearly overwhelmed and (at least our server) dealt with this by being inattentive and incredibly rude. 3. (Related to 1) all the seafood tasted like it had been cooked in big batches and then microwaved to reheat.

I ordered shrimp and scallop broiled combo which came with a lobster tail (even though I  didnâ€™t order it). The lobster tail meat was so hard you couldnâ€™t even cut it with a steak knife. The scallops were good though they were soggy from sitting in a bath of butter dumped everywhere (see picture). The shrimp were rubbery.

The only truly good thing was the calamari

Just returned from celebrating my daughters associates degree at this great establishment.  We were served by Londell, but all the staff was amazing and attentive. There was no wait for seating,  as this is a huge restaurant.  The staff was respectful,  professional,  friendly,  and accommodating.  I believe John was the maitre d' or manager and he was very involved in making sure the guests were happy.  The drinks were great but the food was out of this world.  The portions were huge and the seafood was fresh and tasty.  Already planning a return trip! It's not a bougie place with white tablecloths,  but this unpretentious establishment is worth the visit!

Food: starts you off with free garlic bread and salad, which were both high quality and did not feel like just pass off items. We ordered the BBQ feast for 2. Be advised that this meal can feed 4-5 persons with leftovers for a doggie bag. Especially if you already ate the garlic bread, salad and an app. Seafood was fresh! The jumbo shrimp was massive. Crab and lobster did not disappoint and the ribs and chicken were tender and tasty. Drinks were just right and priced well. 5 stars â­ï¸

Service: firstly, there is valet parking and they didnâ€™t even expect a tip ğŸ’¯. Food service was one of the best Iâ€™ve received at a restaurant. Note: itâ€™s not a buttoned up fancy dining, so the waiters are relaxed, friendly, inviting, theyâ€™re pretty much easy going beach dudes who will chat you up while you booze up. Shout out to Billy, our server who was the chillest dude ever! 5 stars â­ï¸

Atmosphere: The chairs and tables are basic, nothing fancy about the furniture and I think thatâ€™s intentional to match the vibe. Sit on the outside for the sunset view. Take in the yachts and the swan families while you dine. When youâ€™re finished dining, take a walk on the dock and snap some pics with your date or your family to remember the vibe. 5 stars â­ï¸

I will highly recommend this spot for city folk from the other boroughs who want to get out of the hustle and enjoy something different: fresh seafood, a chill vibe, nice ambiance.
Had the June special which was very good. Staff was very courteous.

Fantastic restaurant, total NY style experience, itâ€™s my go to for special occasions.  Tonight we had a typically great meal as always.  The food is always fresh, perfectly cooked and prepared.  Billy and Israel were our servers, they make you feel like your family very attentive to your needs. We sat outside overlooking the bay, the atmosphere is amazing the sun setting on the bay is magical.   We celebrated my wifeâ€™s birthday, she was so happy.  They start off with salad and plate of cheese when you get seated, then bring you garlic bread that is so delicious that you want to order more but shouldnâ€™t.  Then we had steamers, fried calamari for appetizers absolutely delicious melt in your mouth.  My son ordered prime rib perfectly cooked medium rare.  My other son ordered chicken parmigiana outstanding.  I ordered shrimp scampi over linguine, my wife got the broiled seafood platter.  Everything is great every bite is epic.  Something to consider when coming here, the portions are huge so come on an empty stomach!!  If your trying to watch your calories these meals are easily split between two people.  Highly recommend this restaurant.

Food was amazing! Water glasses were never empty. The waiter was on point with everything. The owner even talked with us for 15 min getting to know us. It was just an all around pleasant atmosphere. Will definitely be going there again.

If you love seafood â™¥ï¸ go there. Waiters very attentive,portions were huge. Fish was fresh and tasty. I had broiled seafood  platter. My husband had the fried seafood. Included was a salad,antipasto and bread. Could not eat it all. 1 serving can easily serve 2. Only downside no view of water.

Food delicious and plentiful.  Very good deal for lobster dinner $50.  Includes soup, salad, 3 big baked clams, 3 big mussels, corn, potato, veg, ice cream cake. Waiter Billy very attentive.  Owner stopped by table which was a very nice touch. Highly recommend

This place is a family favorite of mines. Not only is the customer service always great but the food never fails to make me ask for a to-go box. For 5 people we paid $360+ with a tip. I would say this is the best location for seafood in all of city island. There is a reason this place is separated from all other restaurants in CI. Families, couples, even children love coming here. One night, they sang 3 birthday songs in a row. This place is serious business and I wish them well in the future. GEMS OF THE BRONX!

What a great gem!!

Shout out to Carlos and Izzy but theyâ€™re all great!!

The service is fast!

Every single person there is very sweet!

The food is great!

Itâ€™s all very fresh. I was not sure what to expect but they absolutely outdid themselves!!!

Okay i tried this spot again.  What a difference the food was excellent I had the fried snapper fillet.  Impeccable service.  Nice scenic view from the water.  Steven the waiter was wonderful and kind and very attentive.  Happy eating.
Came back the next day to eat some more and was greeted by a nasty valet male who was real adamant about parking my car.  I went to park my own car and then when he spotted me he told me I would have to leave back out and wait for him to park my car. I left out alright and went to Sammyâ€™s down the street. Iâ€™ve been going to this restaurant for years. I got turned away and asked to leave because I did not allow this fake valet man inside of my car to park it.
The nerve

Hands down,  Wish I could give them 10 ğŸŒŸ  review.
I am visiting  from  South Florida .For the first time, I agree that food in New York tastes  better . At City Island. No one playing  games  !!!! FOOD WAS AMAZING! ğŸ˜‹ the waiters  Oscar and Jorge  were incredible ğŸ‘ğŸ™Œ, no time to ask for anything,  they got it under control.
Until the  end.
Just take a look at the  pictures, and you will agree with me, The desert  was to die for, the cheesecake  unbelievably delicious.
Forgot to take pictures until I was almost finished. I was sooooo excited ğŸ˜Š .
You will see the leftovers. One good detail I have never seen in Florida is
I was very  surprised,  They  provided  us with some warm towels to clean  our hands .
Thank you  for this great experience, and we chose this  great restaurant to celebrate our lovely cousin Eileen's birthday ğŸ‚  and had the best quality time with  our family.

Love this place !!!
We will return to  this amazing place !!!

Surprised the gave apps right away like salad, garlic bread and chowder. We split a lobster special which was more than enough for 2 people. Enjoyed that they gave us bibs. Giant portions so come hungry or ready to share. Service was quick.
The service was extraordinary and the food delicious.   Extremely recommended!
